document_title: Lupus nephritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
The main cause of lupus nephritis is systemic lupus erythematosus. Among the causes of disease, genetics plays the most important role. Many genes have yet to be identified that are associated with this condition. Normally, the immune system is the barrier that protects the body from infection. However, when problems arise, the immune system cannot distinguish between harmful and healthy substances. (3)
Autoimmunity contributes significantly to the pathophysiology of lupus glomerulonephritis. Autoantibodies directed against nuclear factors. Characteristics of lupus nephritis include:
Antigens specifically target nucleosomes.; Autoantibodies with high affinity form intravascular immune complexes (autoantibodies are small in size, only about 200bp); Autoantibodies of certain isotypes trigger complement activation.
